newsitem.title: EGYPT: King Hussein, Mubarak start talks in Egypt.
newsitem.headline: King Hussein, Mubarak start talks in Egypt.

text.p: Jordan's King Hussein and Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak started talks on Tuesday aimed at pushing forward stalled Middle East peace talks.
The two Arab leaders met privately in the Sinai resort of Sharm el-Sheikh. King Hussein was accompanied to Egypt by Prime Minister Abdul-Karim al-Kabariti, officials said.

Jordanian officials in Amman had said they would try to find ways to bridge gaps between Israeli and Palestinian negotiators who have yet to seal an accord on a long overdue Israeli troop redeployment in the West Bank town of Hebron.

The king, seen as Israel's closest Arab ally since his 1994 peace treaty with the Jewish state, has distanced himself in recent weeks from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu after Netanyahu opened a tunnel entrance close to Moslem holy sites in Jerusalem in September, sparking widespread violence.
